description: Write a function that parses a URL and checks if its scheme (e.g., 'http', 'https') matches any in the `allowed_schemes` list (case-insensitive). `allowed_schemes` is a NULL-terminated array. Example (Success): is_url_scheme_allowed("HTTPS://ex.com", ["http", "https", NULL]) -> 1. Example (Failure): is_url_scheme_allowed("file:///etc/passwd", ["http", "https", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that parses a URL and checks if its scheme matches any in the `blocked_schemes` list (case-insensitive). `blocked_schemes` is a NULL-terminated array. Example (Blocked): is_url_scheme_blocked("file:///etc/passwd", ["file", "ftp", NULL]) -> 1. Example (Allowed): is_url_scheme_blocked("http://ex.com", ["file", "ftp", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` string is a literal IPv4 (e.g., '1.2.3.4') or literal IPv6 (e.g., '[::1]') address. Example (IPv4): is_hostname_literal_ip("127.0.0.1") -> 1. Example (Domain): is_hostname_literal_ip("example.com") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ip_str` falls within any of the `private_ranges`. `private_ranges` is a NULL-terminated array of CIDR strings. Example (Blocked): is_ip_in_ranges("10.0.0.1", ["10.0.0.0/8", NULL]) -> 1. Example (Public): is_ip_in_ranges("8.8.8.8", ["10.0.0.0/8", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ip_str` falls within any `loopback_ranges`. `loopback_ranges` is a NULL-terminated array of CIDR strings. Example (Blocked): is_ip_in_ranges("127.0.0.1", ["127.0.0.0/8", NULL]) -> 1. Example (Public): is_ip_in_ranges("8.8.8.8", ["127.0.0.0/8", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ip_str` falls within any `link_local_ranges`. `link_local_ranges` is a NULL-terminated array of CIDR strings. Example (Blocked): is_ip_in_ranges("169.254.1.1", ["169.254.0.0/16", NULL]) -> 1. Example (Public): is_ip_in_ranges("8.8.8.8", ["169.254.0.0/16", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ip_str` falls within any `reserved_ranges`. `reserved_ranges` is a NULL-terminated array of CIDR strings. Example (Blocked): is_ip_in_ranges("192.0.2.1", ["192.0.2.0/24", NULL]) -> 1. Example (Public): is_ip_in_ranges("8.8.8.8", ["192.0.2.0/24", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` is present in the `allowed_domains` list (case-insensitive). `allowed_domains` is a NULL-terminated array. Example (Allowed): is_hostname_in_list("GitHub.com", ["google.com", "github.com", NULL]) -> 1. Example (Denied): is_hostname_in_list("malicious.com", ["google.com", "github.com", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` matches any string in the `denied_domains` list (case-insensitive). `denied_domains` is a NULL-terminated array. Example (Denied): is_hostname_in_list("localhost", ["localhost", "127.0.0.1", NULL]) -> 1. Example (Allowed): is_hostname_in_list("google.com", ["localhost", "127.0.0.1", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that parses a URL, extracts its port, and checks if the port is in the `allowed_ports` list. `allowed_ports` is a 0-terminated integer array. If no port is specified, use 80 for 'http' and 443 for 'https'. Example (Allowed): is_url_port_allowed("http://ex.com:8080", [80, 443, 8080, 0]) -> 1. Example (Denied): is_url_port_allowed("http://ex.com:1234", [80, 443, 8080, 0]) -> 0.

Write a function that parses a URL, extracts its hostname, and checks if it is a literal IP address *and* that IP is in the `allowed_ips` list. `allowed_ips` is a NULL-terminated array. Example (Allowed): is_url_host_allowed_ip("http://1.1.1.1", ["1.1.1.1", NULL]) -> 1. Example (Not IP): is_url_host_allowed_ip("http://google.com", ["1.1.1.1", NULL]) -> 0. Example (Not Allowed): is_url_host_allowed_ip("http://8.8.8.8", ["1.1.1.1", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that parses a URL, extracts its hostname, and checks if it matches any string in the `definitions` list (case-insensitive). `definitions` is a NULL-terminated array. Example (Match): is_url_hostname_in_list("http://LocalHost/", ["localhost", "127.0.0.1", NULL]) -> 1. Example (No Match): is_url_hostname_in_list("http://google.com/", ["localhost", "127.0.0.1", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that validates a `webhook_url`. It must use 'https' and its hostname must NOT be a literal IP address. Example (Valid): is_valid_webhook_url("https://hooks.example.com") -> 1. Example (Bad Scheme): is_valid_webhook_url("http://hooks.example.com") -> 0. Example (Literal IP): is_valid_webhook_url("https://1.2.3.4") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if an `ip_str` is an exact match for any string in the `ip_list`. `ip_list` is a NULL-terminated array. Example (Match): is_ip_in_list("169.254.169.254", ["169.254.169.254", NULL]) -> 1. Example (No Match): is_ip_in_list("1.2.3.4", ["169.254.169.254", NULL]) -> 0.

Write a function that checks if `hostname` is an exact match or a subdomain of `parent_domain` (case-insensitive). Example (Match): is_subdomain("api.google.com", "google.com") -> 1. Example (Exact Match): is_subdomain("google.com", "google.com") -> 1. Example (No Match): is_subdomain("google.com.api.com", "google.com") -> 0.

Write a function that parses a URL and extracts the port number. If no port is specified, use 80 for 'http' and 443 for 'https'. Example (Explicit): get_url_port("http://ex.com:8080") -> 8080. Example (Default): get_url_port("https://ex.com") -> 443. Example (Malformed): get_url_port("bad-url") -> -1.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` string contains only valid characters (alphanumerics, hyphen, and dot). Example (Valid): is_valid_hostname_chars("a-b.com") -> 1. Example (Invalid): is_valid_hostname_chars("a_b.com") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if an `int port` is within the range [`min_port`, `max_port`] (inclusive). Example (In Range): is_port_in_range(1024, 1024, 49151) -> 1. Example (Out of Range): is_port_in_range(80, 1024, 49151) -> 0.

Write a function that extracts the root domain from a `hostname` (e.g., 'sub.api.google.com' -> 'google.com') and checks if it matches `root_domain` (case-insensitive). Example (Match): matches_root_domain("sub.api.google.com", "google.com") -> 1. Example (No Match): matches_root_domain("google.api.com", "google.com") -> 0.

Write a function that validates a URL. It must return 1 if the URL's hostname part is a domain name (not a literal IP address). Example (Domain): is_url_hostname_not_ip("http://example.com") -> 1. Example (IP): is_url_hostname_not_ip("http://1.2.3.4") -> 0. Example (Malformed): is_url_hostname_not_ip("bad-url") -> 0.
Write a utility function that compares two strings `s1` and `s2` case-insensitively. Example (Match): stricmp_custom("Hello", "hello") -> 1. Example (No Match): stricmp_custom("Hello", "world") -> 0.

Write a utility function that checks if `str` starts with `prefix` (case-insensitive). Example (Match): str_starts_with_case("HttpClient", "http") -> 1. Example (No Match): str_starts_with_case("HttpClient", "tcp") -> 0.

Write a utility function that checks if `str` ends with `suffix` (case-insensitive). Example (Match): str_ends_with_case("image.JPG", ".jpg") -> 1. Example (No Match): str_ends_with_case("image.png", ".jpg") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a URL contains embedded credentials (e.g., 'http://user:pass@host/'). Example (No Creds): url_has_no_credentials("http://host.com/") -> 1. Example (Has Creds): url_has_no_credentials("http://user:pass@host.com/") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a URL contains a fragment (e.g., '#section1'). Example (No Fragment): url_has_no_fragment("http://ex.com/path?q=1") -> 1. Example (Has Fragment): url_has_no_fragment("http://ex.com/path#section") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` ends with any suffix in the `internal_tlds` list (case-insensitive). `internal_tlds` is a NULL-terminated array. Example (Match): hostname_has_tld("db.internal", [".local", ".internal"]) -> 1. Example (No Match): hostname_has_tld("db.com", [".local", ".internal"]) -> 0.

Write a function that checks if an `int port` is in the 'well-known' range (1-1023). Example (True): is_port_well_known(80) -> 1. Example (False): is_port_well_known(1024) -> 0. Example (False): is_port_well_known(0) -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` contains any non-ASCII characters (bytes > 127). Example (Has Unicode): hostname_has_unicode("example\xC2\xA9.com") -> 1. Example (ASCII only): hostname_has_unicode("example.com") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if `hostname` is an exact match or a subdomain of any domain in the `parent_domains` list. `parent_domains` is a NULL-terminated array. Example (Match): is_subdomain_of_list("api.google.com", ["google.com", "github.com", NULL]) -> 1. Example (No Match): is_subdomain_of_list("google.com.fake.com", ["google.com", "github.com", NULL]) -> 0.
Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ip_str` is a multicast address (224.0.0.0/4). Example (True): is_ip_multicast("224.0.0.1") -> 1. Example (False): is_ip_multicast("192.168.1.1") -> 0.
Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ip_str` is the 'unspecified' address '0.0.0.0'. Example (True): is_ip_unspecified("0.0.0.0") -> 1. Example (False): is_ip_unspecified("1.2.3.4") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ip_str` is the 'broadcast' address '255.255.255.255'. Example (True): is_ip_broadcast("255.255.255.255") -> 1. Example (False): is_ip_broadcast("1.2.3.4") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` contains any invalid characters specified in `invalid_chars` (a simple string, e.g., "_!"). Example (Invalid): hostname_has_invalid_chars("my_host", "_!") -> 1. Example (Valid): hostname_has_invalid_chars("my-host", "_!") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a URL `url` contains a query string (i.e., a '?' character). Example (True): url_has_query("http://ex.com/path?a=1") -> 1. Example (False): url_has_query("http://ex.com/path") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` (or any of its labels) starts or ends with a hyphen '-'. Example (Invalid): hostname_has_hyphen_start_end("-ex.com") -> 1. Example (Invalid): hostname_has_hyphen_start_end("ex.com-") -> 1. Example (Valid): hostname_has_hyphen_start_end("my-host.com") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if any label (part between dots) in a `hostname` is longer than 63 characters. Example (Invalid): hostname_label_too_long("a...[64 chars]...a.com") -> 1. Example (Valid): hostname_label_too_long("my.host.com") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if the total length of a `hostname` exceeds 253 characters. Example (Invalid): hostname_total_too_long("a...[254 chars]...a.com") -> 1. Example (Valid): hostname_total_too_long("my.host.com") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if the path component of a `url` contains a '..' sequence, which could indicate path traversal. Example (Found): url_path_has_dot_dot("http://ex.com/path/../etc/passwd") -> 1. Example (Not Found): url_path_has_dot_dot("http://ex.com/path/foo.bar") -> 0.
Write a function that checks if an `int port` is in the 'dynamic' or 'private' range (49152-65535). Example (True): is_port_dynamic(50000) -> 1. Example (False): is_port_dynamic(8080) -> 0.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` consists only of digits (e.g., '123456'), which is sometimes used to bypass IP regex. Note: this should return 0 for a valid IP '1.2.3.4'. Example (True): is_hostname_numeric("123456789") -> 1. Example (False): is_hostname_numeric("example.com") -> 0. Example (False): is_hostname_numeric("127.0.0.1") -> 0.

Write a function that checks if `url` has a valid format (e.g., 'scheme://host'). It does not need to be a full RFC 3986 parser. Example (Valid): is_url_valid_format("http://google.com") -> 1. Example (Invalid): is_url_valid_format("google.com") -> 0. Example (Invalid): is_url_valid_format("http:/google.com") -> 0.
